frontmatter.title: Tabs
frontmatter.description: Tabs are used to segregate related content.

internal.content:
--- title: Tabs description: Tabs are used to segregate related content. tabs: ["Usage"] showMobile: true --- Tabs are used to navigate between segregated content that is related and is at the same level of hierarchy. ### Variants Tabs come in **3 variants** - default, with icon and with count. #### Default Default variant consists of just a label. ![Default tabs](./images/tabs-1.png)
#### With icon This variant consists of an icon along with the label. Icons should only be used when they add additional value to the label. ![Tabs with icons](./images/tabs-2.png)
#### With count This variant displays the count along with the label. ![Tabs with count](./images/tabs-3.png)

### States Tabs come in **4 states** - default, selected, active, and disabled. ![States of tabs](./images/tabs-4.png)

### Usage #### Tabs vs bottom navigation Tabs are used to group related content and act as filters. While bottom navigation on the other hand is used to navigate between independent pages. ![Related content segregated using - (Left) Tabs vs (Right) Bottom navigation](./images/tabs-5.png)

#### Notifications Notifications can be shown with a red dot alongside the label to indicate the availability of new information. It can be used in combination with any of the tab variants. ![(Image 1) Default tabs with notification dot vs (Image 2) Tabs with count & notification dot vs (Image 3) Tabs with icon & notification dot](./images/tabs-6.png)

#### Overflow behavior Tabs can scroll horizontally if the width of the tab group exceeds the viewport. A linear gradient shows up on either edge to indicate the overflowed tabs. **Note**: Whenever possible, the selected tab should be at the center of the screen in case of an overflow. ![(Image 1) Scroll indication in right vs (Image 2) Scroll indication in both edges vs (Image 3) Scroll indication in left](./images/tabs-7.png)

#### Tab label Tabs should have short and scannable labels, generally limited to a single word. #### Maximum tabs Too many tabs can unnecessarily clutter the UI. Hence it is recommended to **not use more than 5 tabs** at once. However, it is possible to use more than 5 tabs if the need arises.
